newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: CRICKET-3RD NZ-ENGLAND TEST SET FOR THRILLING END.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-3RD NZ-ENGLAND TEST SET FOR THRILLING END.

text.p: The third and final cricket test between England and New Zealand was set for an exciting finish at Lancaster Park in the final session on Tuesday.
At tea, England were 257 for six, requiring 305 to win, another 48 runs with four wickets standing.
John Crawley was on 13, after 78 minutes at the crease, and Dominic Cork was on 16.
England appeared to have the match under control at lunch when they were 203 for three.
However, New Zealand captured three wickets in the space of 16 balls to climb back into the game.
Captain Mike Atherton, having completed his 11th test century, edged a catch to wicketkeeper Adam Parore off medium pacer Nathan Astle to end his stand at 118 runs.
He had batted 399 minutes, faced 311 balls and hit 11 fours.
Atherton and Nasser Hussain added 80 in 179 balls to put England on course for victory.
Hussain was then caught at silly mid-off four balls later off left-arm spinner Daniel Vettori for 33, and Graham Thorpe hit a return catch back to Vettori shortly after.
Vettori, in just his fourth first-class match, had bowled a marathon 53 overs and had taken four for 83.
New Zealand need to win the test to square the three-match rubber after losing the second test.
